chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Hayley Danielle McFee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business tomorrow.
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: Undergo a Substance Abuse Assmt & comply with all treatment recommendations.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
The Def is to take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and only in the manner & dosage as prescribed!
Complete Moral Recognition Therapy as directed by the DOC.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

timeConds.notes:
Granted work release under the terms set by the Sheriff.  
Has 56 days remaining to serve.
Consecutive to: any other sentence def is ordered to serve and 21CF189 and 21CF204.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hayley Danielle McFee

records.addlTxt: AMENDED

1:04 PM Defendant Hayley Danielle McFee in court, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court for Hayley Danielle McFee.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CF189, 21CF204, and 22CF38.  21CF189 convicted of counts 1 and 2 both as a repeater.  21CF204 convicted of counts 1 and 3 both as a repeater.  22CF38 convicted of counts 1, 2, and 8 all as a repeater.  PSI was ordered.  PSI was filed 10/10 Judge has reviewed.  Atty no agreement for sentencing.  Atty, def is not serving a sentence she is on a hold that is for sentencing after revocation set before Judge Stella on 11/17.  Def is agreeable to probation.  The substance use component of the PSI does not talk about treatment in any way and omits information about treatment.  Def is a graduate of Treatment Court and successfully completed the program.  State has complied with victim rights.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  Def makes a statement.  Court orders:  On each ct in each case on 5 felony counts 3 yrs probation on 2 mis 2 yrs.  Conditional jail 21CF189 ct 1 60 days, 21cf204 ct 1 90 days, 22cf38 ct 1 150 days total 350 days.  On jail granted work release under terms set by the sheriff.  Other conditions include rep by close of business tomorrow, SAA, Absol, prescribed, MRT as directed by DOC if directed by DOC, each ct pay court costs paid through DOC, No Fire on felony/Vote, consecutive to each other 90 days, commence effective immediately for conditional jail.  State agrees 244 days credit:  served jail in 21CF189 and 21cf204 and has 56 days remaining in 22cf38.
St's Sentencing Recommendation
Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Nov 1 and needs to be here in person;  ka
Sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Email sent to ACJ w/copy of transport order advising def to be here Aug 19;  ka
Email sent to Oneida County advising def has court on Aug 19;  ka
Plea hearing on August 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

1:05 PM Defendant Hayley Danielle McFee appeared by video, in custody in Oneida Co Jail.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder appeared by video for Hayley Danielle McFee. 21CF189,21CF204,22CF38-- Back on the record 1:25pm-- Atty comments asking for a PLEAH hearing in the cases.
If the def wants to appr in person Atty will need to let the ACJ and COC office know.
Plea hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Email sent to Oneida County advising def has court on July 25;  ka
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hayley Danielle McFee appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for Hayley Danielle McFee. Dan Syder appears by video. 
21CF189,21CF204,22CF38-- Atty Snyder on two cases and Atty Brewer on one case. Atty Snyder comments--Needs to go over offer with the def and other atty. Atty Brewer comments- rec'd offer on the 24th. Atty Snyder is on the two cases as Co aptments, Ct will NOT apt him on the case the SPD is already apt'd
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Email sent to Oneida county jail advising def has court on June 27;  ka

02:29 PM Defendant Hayley Danielle McFee in court with attorney Heidi E. Brewer, Dan Snyder.  Defendant Hayley Danielle McFee in custody Ondeia Co jail.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hayley Danielle McFee appeared by video means with Attorney.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Atty Snyder comments on his cases that are set for INIT. 21CF204,22CF38-- waives reading of compl, Ct posted $1500 cash bail and def is on a PO hold. Def will waive right to a prelim in both of the cases. 
21CF204,22CF38--   Ct finds know and vol waives right to prelim. Ct finds PC the def com a fel in Ashland Co & bound over for argnmt.State is filing info now, same charges as in the compl,.Waives reading of info, pleads NG on each charges, noted  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Covers cases 21CF204, 21CF189 and New Charges.
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.

Defendant no to operate any motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Physical address. State comments on bail/bond. Req. $1500 cash bail. ABSOL. Def's Atty Heidi Brewer comments on bail/bond. Req. low cash bond/high sig.
